climbs.name: Bolts, Butter and a Waffle Cutter
climbs.fa: FA: Eric Fox/ Ashley Currie  FFA:Ian Lingley/ Eric Fox

content.description:
After the small scramble. Start from the ledge, first bolt is a little high but can be easily clipped from a good stance; featured slab will lead you to an easy blocky section where the anchor can be clipped.Well protected easy climbing makes for a great first lead. 

This climb is located on the waffle wall. Start in the bottom of the gully, 5.2 climbing will bring you to a small ledge on the left 20ft up.
4 Bolts + 2 Raprings

climbs.name: Bucket Brigade
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Valerie Anctil, and Shawn Bethune June 2022

content.description:
A great first lead. Fun climb despite the length and level of difficulty.



Just right of 420.

2 bolts, bolted anchor

climbs.name: Four-Twenty
climbs.fa: FA: Eric Fox/ Ashley Currie/ Mike Vautour  FFA:Ian Lingley/ Eric Fox

content.description:
This climb was climbed on April 20th 2008 and was one of the first lines to be looked at since the Original route was put up. Four-Twenty follow a series of crimps and ledges to a big horizontal crack with a tree in it. Pull directly passed the tree and then trend a little left to the anchor.

Located on the left side about 25 feet before the escape gully.
3 bolts + 2 raprings

climbs.name: Half Baked
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Sam Duke and Luke Perrin, May 2021

content.description:
Fun start leads up to a tricky little crux. Move left after pulling crux to a narrow ledge and then up to an easy section. 



The fourth bolted line starting from the left hand side of the wall. 

3 protection bolts, 2 bolt anchor

Follow the bolted line straight up through some balance moves to a large horizontal crack. Once in the horizontal clip the bolt just above then work up and right towards the next bolt. 
 This Route has some rough looking rock up and left of the horizontal, I removed all the loose rock I could, but try not to haul on it. Some use it for their left hand while clipping the anchor.    

This line is located just left of Four-Twenty,
5 bolts + 2 raprings

This route is located right of the Original route, follows the bolts sharing the last 2 with the original route. Featured rock provides good rests and a great view of the river.

This is located on the left side of the cliff.
5 bolts + 2 raprings

A Great route on a nice exposed arête, climb up the slab with a few large ledges, try keeping left of the last 2 bolts.   
 The original route was bolted by Tom Anderson and was the first bolted line in the Green Head area; it was originally equipped with 2 bolts and a traditional placement near the top. With the development of new routes in the area 2 more bolts and a rap anchor were added to make a great exposed sport line.  

Located on the left most section of wall.

7 bolts, bolted anchor, rap the route

Easy start then up to a seemingly blank section but the holds are there if you look around. A couple of fun moves take you through the crux and then an easy mantle to a ledge.



About 25 feet right of the start of the wall and 6 feet right of Jack the Clipper. 

3 protection bolts and a bolted anchor

The Main Cliff left starts on the left most section of wall where the original route is located, and continues to the Escape gully. This was the first wall to be developed in this area. The First development was by Tom Anderson with the original route, then years later with Eric Fox and Ashley Currie on Four-Twenty. The rock quality on this side is pretty good; primarily slab climbing with a few vertical sections makes for fun sport climbing.
